qas.question: Which team did not qualifty for Champions League in 2005 but was able to particpate?

answers.text: UEFA gave special dispensation for Liverpool to enter the Champions League

qas.question: Did the Liverpool Club place in the Champions League in 2005?

answers.text: in 2005, after Liverpool won the Champions League the year before, but did not finish in a Champions League qualification place

qas.question: How many qualifiers did England have for the Champions League in 2005?

answers.text: UEFA gave special dispensation for Liverpool to enter the Champions League, giving England five qualifiers.

qas.question: Do defending champtions get to play in the following year's Champions League if they don't have enough wins to qualify

answers.text: UEFA subsequently ruled that the defending champions qualify for the competition the following year regardless of their domestic league placing.

qas.question: How many winning teams from an association can participate in the Champions League?

answers.text: No association can have more than four entrants in the Champions League

qas.question: Which team received special dispensation from the UEFA in 2005 so they could enter the Champions League?

Associations can have no more than five entrants in which league?
In which year did an exception to the usual Chelsea qualifying system happen?
Who did Tottenham Hotspur qualify in place of?
In 2005, Chelsea qualified for the Champions League in place of who?

context: An exception to the usual European qualification system happened <a1_0>in <b12_0>2005<b12_0/>, after <a5_0>Liverpool<a5_0/> won the Champions League the year before, but did not finish in a Champions League qualification place<a1_0/> in the Premier League that season. <a0_0><a2_0>UEFA gave special dispensation for Liverpool to enter the <b10_0>Champions League<b10_0/><a0_0/>, giving England five qualifiers.<a2_0/> <a3_0>UEFA subsequently ruled that <a6_0>the defending champions<a6_0/> qualify for the competition the following year regardless of their domestic league placing.<a3_0/> However, for those leagues with four entrants in the Champions League, this meant that if the Champions League winner finished outside the top four in its domestic league, it would qualify at the expense of <a7_0>the fourth-placed team<a7_0/> in the league. <a4_0>No association can have more than four entrants in the <b11_0>Champions League<b11_0/><a4_0/>. This occurred in 2012, when <a8_0><b13_0>Chelsea<b13_0/><a8_0/> – who had won the Champions League the previous year, but finished sixth in the league – qualified for the Champions League in place of <a9_0><b14_0>Tottenham Hotspur<b14_0/><a9_0/>, who went into the Europa League.
